results.content:
Great course, as is expected from Academind. Good grasp on native Web Component concepts and APIs. Great coverage of Stencil.js concepts. Studying this course while following the Web Component guide on MDN and the Stencil.js documentation is the best.

A minor flaw, though. at the time of writing this review, some APIs of Stencil.js have now been modified or deprecated. An example of this would be the @Method decorator. It is now expected to return a Promise.

Overall, a great course. Highly recommended.

results.content:
Decent course. But there are reasons I can't call it a great course. 

1. The instructor's accent is really hard to follow. In each sentence you have changes in pitch and volume for each word. If there was any consistency, it might be easier, but I got to a point early on where I couldn't even listen to the instructor talk anymore. So, that is kind of a problem.

2. Course speed. You'll have to pause the video constantly. Especially in areas where there is coding involved. This instructor FLYS through the code. Which makes it hard to keep up. 

3. Course structure. There are some parts of the course where the structure of the lesson is either bad or the way the instructor processes info is bad. Too many times you'll see the instructor talking about point "A" then he appears to get lost and start scrolling and clicking everywhere. 

4. Final thoughts. It seems like the course was just thrown together. The non-stop barrage of info is a highly condensed space brings about this thought. Overall, it's cool to learn about Stencil and web components, but there is some content missing. For example, almost everything we did was in the shadow DOM, and I can easily come up with reasons to not use the shadow DOM. Yet, we didn't cover much of non-shadow DOM usage.

results.content:
It was a very good course. Max is a great teacher and I have taken several courses by him. That is good for me, but it did not help the rating of this course. Many of his other courses are much more in-depth and longer covering adjacent technology and a course project. This course on Stencil.js seems very lacking in comparison. There is no course project, and the whole course is around 9 hours compared to around 45-50 hours for his other courses. I think more could have been presented on how to build a full front-end since Stencil.js also provides tools on Routing and State as auxiliary packages -- but none of that was covered like it was in his other courses. When he covered React, he covered the auxiliary packages. Here he does not, he only covers components.

But he does a great job at what he does cover. I appreciate the tutorial on web components before jumping into Stencil.js. I still recommend everyone take all of his courses.

results.content_html:
It was a very good course. Max is a great teacher and I have taken several courses by him. That is good for me, but it did not help the rating of this course. Many of his other courses are much more in-depth and longer covering adjacent technology and a course project. This course on Stencil.js seems very lacking in comparison. There is no course project, and the whole course is around 9 hours compared to around 45-50 hours for his other courses. I think more could have been presented on how to build a full front-end since Stencil.js also provides tools on Routing and State as auxiliary packages -- but none of that was covered like it was in his other courses. When he covered React, he covered the auxiliary packages. Here he does not, he only covers components.

But he does a great job at what he does cover. I appreciate the tutorial on web components before jumping into Stencil.js. I still recommend everyone take all of his courses.

results.content: This course is perfect for a web developer that is currently living in the React.js ecosystem that wants to be able to leverage existing skills in building production-ready native web components. Great work!

The Excercises are really great. You can try to get those done and test your progress that way. The Topics are very detailed and every aspect like styling, reformatting of the codes, re-coding with better do's is in this course.

You can follow the English of Maximilian without any problems. I highly recommend this cource to anyone interesting in learning about Web Components and Stencil.js :)

results.content: Awesome course on web components and stencil. By the end of the course you should be able to build your own basic web components using stencil provided you coded along and tried to implement some of the features on your own. Max is easily one of the best instructors on Udemy (the best I've seen). Keep producing great content, Max!

response.content: I'll try my best - thanks for your awesome feedback! :)

results.content:
Regarding Web Components basics I already knew a lot of the content. However I really appreciate the styling part and slots and this was a really good refresher. 

Regarding Stencil.js I already knew some basics. I really appreciate the teaching method by knowledge blocks building on top of each other and showing the "complicated", naive way first and then the simpler Stencil-way.

The teacher also threw in some knowledge on CSS and basic Javascript as some side notes which rounds this course up.

The teaching method, pace and speech (pronunciation) is very good. For people with good English understanding 1.5x playback speed will be just fine!

This course is intended for developers with decent understanding in HTML/DOM/CSS and Javascript but developers with some basic understanding of WebComponents won't regret taking this course too as it gives a structured start into this topic.

results.content:
This course not only teaches Stencil.js as a tool but gives also a good understanding of plain Custom HTML Elements in vanilla JS - something that most of the time in videos on for example YouTube will be missing. And with the understanding how plain Custom HTML Elements work you will get also a better understanding what is going on under the hood of Stencil.js and what benefit it will bring you if you use it.

Ones again a great course with Maximilian Schwarzmüller.

Thanks for the course !

response.content: Thank YOU so much - I'm glad you're liking it!

results.content: I got what I needed out of the course, and am very excited by what I've learned, but the presentation is less polished than I expected. The presenter often makes small mistakes and has to go back and clean them up – sometimes in a subsequent video – or writes unnecessarily untidy code (e.g. using different, inconsistent indenting from one file to another). If you like this sort of “low-fi, as-it-happened” presentation style, this might be OK for you. I would have preferred a more careful, prepared presentation that eliminated those distractions.

results.content:
Really great course, really good transfer of knowledge from the Maximilian Schwarzmüller. I would really like to see some other course, to see how to create some bigger app using components with some routing, services for calling for some data and maybe some advice how should the structure for bigger projects without stencil should look like.
Really like that there are more than one resolutions for the same problems shown. Almost every line of code is commented why it is used like this, thats great for better understanding.
Another good thing is there are external links to a nice tutorials not only made by the author like CSS Flex which is used in the course.
